subject: Re: File from tonight
author: Steve Hultay
full_text:
I just go by what works best at the moment and i have only been doing 
sessions lately approx. once a week if that.  Look at my posts and 
see the lack of activity from me.  Work and other stuff has consumed 
my time and i have just recently been getting good communication and 
it happens to be with your box....you should be proud of your work.  
I have used Evp maker and i get minimal results with it.  Frank, 
random does work well and you should appreciate your accomplishment 
in designing that feature.  I no longer aske for technicians, i only 
ask "Is there someone that would like to communicate with me today?" 
and if they have trouble coming through i will ask for assistance in 
helping them get their message across to me.  As for telepathic 
suggestions, i have been hacking boxes and currently turned my band 
room into a giant Spiricom device and i would never know how to do 
these things.  They are putting ideas into my head all the time to 
better the communication, i open a box up and know what wires are 
what....that's not me at all.  But it's happening and i go with it 
and it seems to be pushing me and others on this board forward.

-Steve H.




--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "purplespacefriend" 
<purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
>
>  Have ya tried EVPmaker? It is based on that random principle, and 
> predates the boxes.
> 
>  I've heard this stuff before, about random being the best, and I 
> have to disaggree. I also think it unwise to spend every waking 
> moment doing sessions. I think it creates that expectation, and 
> perhaps desperation to make contact, and I would tend not to trust 
> what comes through. 
> 
>  I don't trust some of this stuff because I have yet get any 
> meaningful assistence with the boxes from the so called 
technicians. 
> All I ever got was a telepathic "suggestion" to use the echo boxes. 
> Everything else was a assemblage of stuff I had worked on in hte 
past 
> to solve the problem of "what else could I use". 
> 
>  I hate to see yet another go down the road of "this is the onlyest 
> way". 
> 
>  Frank-S
>
